intro: Astronia sorsogonensis, commonly known as the Sorsogon Island starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant produces a fruit that resembles a starfruit, with a thin, smooth skin and a sweet, tangy flavor. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
